ygData.subject: Re: EQ Slowly Dying?
ygData.msgSnippet: My lord, I heard about this game and how good it was (something about use to be a test RPG on AOL) but now that they are making it with graphics and gonna have
ygData.messageBody:
My lord, I heard about this game and how good it was (something about use to
be a test RPG on AOL) but now that they are making it with graphics and
gonna have it on a CD it might be nice to have. But anyways I went to
www.neverwinternights.net and read about it and it sounds like it might be
the RPG of all RPG's, you can be a GM type guy and control monsters,
wildlife and even NPC's. The only thing that might suck is only 20 lvls but
as they said in AD&D lvl 20 is a force to be reckoned with and reaching such
a level is quite the achievement. You can import characters from the BIG
hit Baldur's Gate.
And yes no monthly fee's and you can even play NWN in a single game. Hope
the servers will be good and not all messed up like most free online games.
But anyways this will be a game I try!!

**************************
Azor
Lvl 18 Human Cleric of the Rathe
**************************

> From: "Curtis Bennett" <die_kluge@...>
>
> Come winter of 2000 I will be playing Never Winter Nights.
> www.neverwinternight.net (or .com)
> It's a DM-able Baldur's Gate style game that is fully customizable by
> the host DM. It's gonna blow EQ away in terms of flexibility and
> playability. Once this game comes out, I will never play EQ again.
